solution.text:
Base radius of each pillar, r\(=_{k}_\,m\)
Height of each pillar, h\(=_{l}_\,m\)
No. of pillars, n\(=_{j}_\)
Volume of each pillar\(=\pi r^2h\)
\(=\pi \times _{k}_^2 \times _{l}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*k**2*l),3)}}_\,m^3\)
Amount of concrete mixture required\(=\)Volume of each pillar \(\times\) No. of pillars
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*k**2*l),3)}}_ \times _{j}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*k**2*l*j),3)}}_\,m^3\)

content.text: In ancient roman empire, a king constructed \(_{j}_\) huge pillars at his residence. If each pillar had a base radius of \(_{k}_\)m and height \(_{l}_\)m, how much concrete mixture would be required?
